comments.text: Completely agree with you on AI. It is a good but extremely flawed tool. I frequently double check answers I get from it on just about anything I ask it. I often get conflicting or even wrong answers from it. You definitely have to get very specific to get definitive information.
comments.author: @Bratzilla1966

comments.text: Garden grids are on sale right now. Not sure for how long, but I just bought 2 more.  Love them.  I am computer inept so I’m not sure how well I will do with the AI but will see. I do like have actually paper information in my gardening binder. I do use my phone calendar and alarms for reminders in everything from gardening to medical appts etc. Really learn a lot from your channel.  Thank you !🌺
comments.author: @lindysmallwood2039

comments.text: If you want a complex solution you need to ask the question with built in complexity. You ask a simple question and you get a simplified explanation. Questions that are verifiably researched will be more fact based, but asking an AI about experienced based questions is going to require drilling down in the thread with nuance. It’s useful to ask AI to provide you with a good video on the same topic from expert gardeners.
comments.author: @VistasdelMar2008
